reviews.review_msg: If you like to be bored, take this class. The MOST useless topics are included. Her lectures are full of nonsense and random things that fall out of topic. I understand english may be mundane BUT DO NOT take a class with her if you hate being off topic all the time. Example: 50 min lecture, 10 mins of useful notes

I would say your marks are all depended on your TA. Here I just want to address Maya,my best TA this term, always provides help and is super nice. Betty lectures well, but her stressful 10 minutes in class writings are not fair. Especially her super tough marking scheme.

Betty ran a difficult first year English course. There were many short readings, and lectures were confusing at times. She points out kids at random to answer questions in class, so sit close to the back if you are not confident with the material. Tests, quizzes and papers were marked fairly, but you must put in the time to achieve a high grade.

She and her TAs are tough graders. For a first year English course, she assigns a lot of readings and expects way too much from her students. She does not give out proper notes and her explanations are confusing. As a lecturer she is dull, awkward and lacks passion. However, she does provide good feedback on writing assignments.

Love this guy, shows tons of youtube videos in lecture and the whole semester is really easy going with him. Never picked up the textbook once for this class and ended up with a A-. Just do well on both assignments and your set. BTW no midterm!

Jon is a nice prof, but he is a bit tough on the grading scale. Seems to be a bit of a tough grader and very very attendance focused. He keeps lectures fun and entertaining and the readings are really great, just a lot of them. You have to attend them or you will get a deduction on your grade so be aware of this.
I found that he tried harder to be funny and edgy than to provide anything of educational merit in his lectures. Stay away from this guy.
